intro: Epidorkis polystepis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing perennial, often forming dense clusters of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including shades of purple, pink, and white, and are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value. Epidorkis polystepis prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
